TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ProjectItem extends System.Object

Docs.remarks: Edits to this object will indirectly dirty the containing project because they will modify the backing XML.
Docs.comment: We cannot use a copy-on-write table for the metadata, as ProjectMetadata objects are mutable. However, we do use it for build-time items.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DirectMetadata As IEnumerable(Of ProjectMetadata)

Docs.summary: Metadata directly on the item, if any. Does not include metadata from item definitions. Does not include built-in metadata. Never returns null.
Docs.value: An enumerator over all item metadata, which can never be .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Does not include metadata from item definitions. Does not include built-in metadata, such as "FullPath".

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DirectMetadataCount As Integer
public: property int DirectMetadataCount { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Count of direct metadata on this item, if any. Does NOT count any metadata inherited from item definitions. Does not count built-in metadata, such as "FullPath".
Docs.value: The count of metadata for this item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Does not include metadata from item definitions. Does not include built-in metadata, such as "FullPath".

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property EvaluatedInclude As String
public: property System::String ^ EvaluatedInclude { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the evaluated value of the include, unescaped.
Docs.value: The evaluated value of the Include attribute.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Escaped characters are not present.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectMetadata GetMetadata(string name) cil managed
Public Function GetMetadata (name As String) As ProjectMetadata

Docs.param: The name of the metadata whose value is retrieved.
Docs.summary: Gets an evaluated metadata on this item. Potentially includes a metadata from an item definition. Does not return built-in metadata, such as "FullPath". Returns null if not found.
Docs.returns: The evaluated value of the given metadata for this item, or if no metadata exists with the given name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks May include metadata from an item definition. Does not include built-in metadata, such as "FullPath".

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetMetadataValue(string name) cil managed
Public Function GetMetadataValue (name As String) As String
abstract member GetMetadataValue : string -> string override this.GetMetadataValue : string -> string

Docs.param: The name of the metadata whose value is retrieved.
Docs.summary: Get the evaluated value of a metadata on this item, possibly from an item definition. Returns empty string if it does not exist. To determine whether a piece of metadata does not exist vs. simply has no value, use HasMetadata. May be used to access the value of built-in metadata, such as "FullPath". Attempting to get built-in metadata on a value that is not a valid path throws InvalidOperationException.
Docs.returns: The evaluated value of the given metadata for this item, including metadata originating from an item definition, or an empty string if no metadata exists with the given name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To determine whether metadata exist, whether it has a value or not, use <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem.HasMetadata%2A>.
This method may be used to access the value of built-in metadata, such as "FullPath".

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool HasMetadata(string name) cil managed
Public Function HasMetadata (name As String) As Boolean

Docs.param: The name of the metadata to be searched for.
Docs.summary: Returns true if a particular piece of metadata is defined on this item, otherwise false. Includes built-in metadata and metadata inherited from item definitions.
Docs.returns: if metadata with the given name is defined on this item; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Includes built-in metadata and metadata originating from item definitions.

public: property bool IsImported { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: If the item originated in an imported file, returns true. Otherwise returns false.
Docs.value: if this item originates from an imported file; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Metadata As ICollection(Of ProjectMetadata)

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Metadata on the item, if any. Includes metadata specified by the definition, if any. If there is no metadata, returns an empty collection. Does not include built-in metadata, such as "FullPath". Get the values of built-in metadata using . This is a read-only collection. To modify the metadata, use .
Docs.value: All the metadata for this item, including metadata originating from item definitions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Does not include built-in metadata, such as "FullPath".
To add, remove, or change the values of built-in metadata, use <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem.GetMetadataValue%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem.SetMetadataValue%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MetadataCount As Integer
public: property int MetadataCount { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Count of metadata on this item, if any. Includes any metadata inherited from item definitions. Includes both custom and built-in metadata.
Docs.value: The count of metadata for this item, including any metadata originating from item definitions, and any built-in metadata.

Docs.summary: Project that this item lives in. ProjectItems always live in a project.
Docs.value: The project that contains this project item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Project items are always contained by a project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool RemoveMetadata(string name) cil managed
Public Function RemoveMetadata (name As String) As Boolean

Docs.param: The name of the metadata to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes any metadata with the specified name. Returns true if the evaluated metadata existed, otherwise false. If the metadata name is one of the built-in metadata, like "FullPath", throws InvalidArgumentException. If the metadata originates in an item definition, and was not overridden, throws InvalidOperationException.
Docs.returns: if metadata with the given name exists before removal; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Throws InvalidArgumentException if the metadata name refers to built-in metadata, like "FullPath".
Throws InvalidOperationException if the metadata name refers to metadata that originates from an item definition.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Rename(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The new name of the item.
Docs.summary: Renames the item. Equivalent to setting the value. Generally, no expansion occurs. This is because it would potentially result in several items, which is not meaningful semantics when renaming a single item. However if the item does not need to be split (which would invalidate its ProjectItemElement), and the new value expands to exactly one item, then its evaluated include is updated with the expanded value, rather than the unexpanded value.
Docs.remarks: Even if the new value expands to zero items, we do not expand it. The common case we are interested in for expansion here is setting something like "$(sourcesroot)\foo.cs" and expanding that to a single item. If say "@(foo)" is set as the new name, and it expands to blank, that might be surprising to the host and maybe even unhandled, if on full reevaluation it wouldn’t expand to blank. That’s why we're being cautious and supporting the most common scenario only. Many hosts will do a ReevaluateIfNecessary before reading anyway.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectMetadata SetMetadataValue(string name, string unevaluatedValue) cil managed
Public Function SetMetadataValue (name As String, unevaluatedValue As String) As ProjectMetadata

Docs.param: The name of the metadata to add.
The unevaluated value of the metadata to add.
Docs.summary: Adds metadata with the specified name and value to the item. Updates an existing metadata if one already exists with the same name on the item directly, as opposed to inherited from an item definition. Updates the evaluated project, but does not affect anything else in the project until reevaluation. For example, if a piece of metadata named "m" is added on item of type "i", it does not affect "j" which is evaluated from "@(j->'%(m)')" until reevaluation. Also if the unevaluated value of "m" is set to something that is modified by evaluation, such as "$(p)", the evaluated value will be set to literally "$(p)" until reevaluation. This is a convenience that it is understood does not necessarily leave the project in a perfectly self consistent state without a reevaluation. Returns the new or existing metadatum.
Docs.returns: The new metadata. If metadata with the given name already exists, returns this metadata.
Docs.remarks: Unevaluated value is assumed to be escaped as necessary

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectMetadata SetMetadataValue (string name, string unevaluatedValue, bool propagateMetadataToSiblingItems);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectMetadata SetMetadataValue(string name, string unevaluatedValue, bool propagateMetadataToSiblingItems) cil managed
Public Function SetMetadataValue (name As String, unevaluatedValue As String, propagateMetadataToSiblingItems As Boolean) As ProjectMetadata
public: Microsoft::Build::Evaluation::ProjectMetadata ^ SetMetadataValue(System::String ^ name, System::String ^ unevaluatedValue, bool propagateMetadataToSiblingItems);

Docs.param: If true, adds direct metadata to the from which this originated. The intent is to affect all other sibling items.
Docs.summary:
Overload of . Adds the option of not splitting the item element and thus affecting all sibling items. Sibling items are defined as all ProjectItem instances that were created from the same item element.
This is a convenience that it is understood does not necessarily leave the project in a perfectly self consistent state without a reevaluation
Docs.returns: Returns the new or existing metadatum.
